intro: Scolopia, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their arrow-shaped leaves and striking, often colorful, spadix-shaped inflorescences. Scolopia species are typically herbaceous, with some having rhizomatous growth habits. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique foliage and floral displays.
